node.title: Your favourite women's Ashes moments revealed
node.alt: A compilation of images of women cricketers celebrating
node.description: With Australia once again winning the women's Ashes, it's time to reveal what you voted for as your top moments in the series' history.Â
node.content:
["As Australia's women celebrate winning the Ashes once again, it's time to reveal the moments you selected as your favourite throughout the history of the famous rivalry.\u00a0", "We relived some of our highlights\u00a0as we narrowed it down to our top 20.\u00a0", "We heard from Katherine Brunt and Kate Blackwell as they shed light on England's often overlooked 2005 series win.\u00a0", "Raelee Thompson gave rare insights into the dramatic Jubilee series, and we took a deep dive into the history of the inaugural 1934/35 series.", "Karen Rolton told us what it was like scoring her 209*, while Meg Lanning reflected on storming 'Fortress Chelmsford.'", "Belinda Clark told us about the official birth of the women's Ashes, and Amanda-Jade Wellington looked back on her 'ball of the century.'", "But what were your picks?\u00a0Here's the list, from 10th to first.", "
10. The catch that went viral (2013)
", "", "
Jodie Fields\u00a0looks on as she is caught\u00a0by\u00a0Sarah Taylor, video of the catch was widely shared on social media.(Getty Images: Charlie Crowhurst)
", "It was one of the best catches behind the stumps you'll ever see.", "In her 13 years playing international cricket, Sarah Taylor was widely regarded as one of, if not the best, wicketkeeper in the game.", "And her classic catch of Australia captain Jodie Fields in this Ashes ODI in 2013 showed just why.", "
9: Jo Broadbent gets\u00a0Australia's first\u00a0double ton\u00a0(1998)
", "", "
Joanne Broadbent was the first Australian woman to score a Test double-century.(Getty: Allsport/Craig Prentis)
", "Only four Australian women have ever scored a Test double hundred \u2014\u00a0and Jo Broadbent was the first.", "Her pioneering knock came in the first Test at Guildford in 1998, after more than eight-and-a-half hours at the crease.", "
8:\u00a0The very first Test\u00a0series (1934)
", "", "
Australian and English captains, Margaret Peden and Betty Archdale, tossing the coin.(Supplied: Bradman Museum)
", "\"Girl\u00a0cricketers will have thrilling time\" was a headline in the Australian Women's Weekly at the time.", "And they sure did in the inaugural women's contest between the two nations, held in Australia in 1934-35.", "It's now\u00a087 years since\u00a0Margaret Peden and Betty Archdale led their teams onto Brisbane's Exhibition Ground.", "A reminder of what's possible, when you step boldly to the crease.", "
7:\u00a0Karen Rolton's 209* at Headingley (2001)
", "", "
Karen Rolton\u00a0got a bottle of champagne to celebrate\u00a0her new world record.(Getty Images: Allsport/Mike Finn-Kelcey)
", "Karen Rolton's 209 not out against England broke\u00a0the then-women's-world-record Test score.", "Her 313-ball double ton led Australia to a nine-wicket win and sealed an Ashes series victory on foreign soil.", "
6: Betty Wilson shines\u00a0(1958)
", "", "
Betty Wilson was the first player, woman or man, to score 100 runs and take 10 wickets in the same Test match.(Getty Images: S&G/PA Images)
", "During the second Test in Melbourne, Australia was bowled out for just 38 runs in the\u00a0first innings.", "But then in came Betty Wilson, who bowled out England for 35, taking figures in that innings of 7-7 \u2014 including a hat-trick.", "When Australia batted again, Wilson went on to score a century. And, in Australia's second innings with the ball, she took four wickets for just nine runs.", "
5: Sarah Elliott: breastfeeding and batting her way to 100 (2013)
", "", "
Sarah Elliott was on double-duty in 2013, breastfeeding her son while she wasn't out in the middle scoring runs.(Getty Images: Harry Engels)
", "In 2013 \u2014\u00a0as part of the Ashes series \u2014\u00a0Sarah Elliott became the first mother to tour as a member of the Australian women's cricket team.", "Remarkably, she also scored her maiden Test century while breastfeeding her nine-month-old child, Sam.", "
4:\u00a0Meg Lanning obliterates the England fortress\u00a0(2019)
", "", "
Meg Lanning cracked the fortress that is Chelmsford, smashing a then-world record of 133 not out in the first T20 international.(Reuters: Action Images/Peter Cziborra)
", "No team had ever beaten England at \"Fortress Chelmsford\", until Meg Lanning's magnificent day out on July 26, 2019.", "She was ruthless with a then-world record 133 not out off 63 balls, guiding Australia to its highest ever T20I total of 3-226.", "It was among\u00a0Lanning's finest innings across all formats of the game, cementing her status as one of her country's greatest batters.", "
3: Perry skittles\u00a0England \u2014\u00a0and then keeps delivering\u00a0(2019)
", "", "
Ellyse Perry humiliated England in third one-dayer, taking 7 for 22 off 10 overs.(Reuters: Action Images/Paul Childs)
", "Ellyse Perry won player of the match in this Ashes series, and it's not hard to see why.", "She topped the run-scorers for the series, and was also the series\u2019 most prolific wicket-taker.", "She also became the first player, man or woman, to reach the double of 1,000 runs and 100 wickets in T20 International cricket.", "
2: Ellyse Perry's\u00a0213* and that premature celebration\u00a0(2017)
", "", "
Ellyse Perry's teammates will never let her live down the fact she celebrated her 200 too early.(AAP: Daniel Munoz)
", "This was unforgettable in every way.", "Under the lights at North Sydney Oval, Ellyse Perry celebrated one of the biggest moments of her career, not once, but twice.", "On 194, she thought she'd struck a six and started to salute the crowd , only to be told it didn't quite make it.\u00a0", "She had to wait a few more deliveries, but eventually\u00a0produced the highest individual Test score by an Australian woman, with a more subdued reaction the second time around.", "
1: Amanda-Jade Wellington's 'ball of the century'\u00a0(2017)
", "", "
Amanda-Jade Wellington's ball was widely compared to Shane Warne's \"ball of the century\", that bowled England's Mike Gatting.(Getty Images: Jason McCawley)
", "It was a ball that left commentators gushing.", "\"Amanda-Jade Wellington has bowled an absolute peach.", "And the ball later went viral for its comparisons to Shane Warne's 1993 Gatting \"ball of the century.\"", "Fittingly, while Warne's ball was chosen as your\u00a0top men's Ashes moment of the past 40 years, Wellington has now taken out the women's top spot \u2014\u00a0by a comfortable margin too."]
